API Knowledge:
The available scenarios of javax.servlet.http.Cookie.setMaxAge(): need to control how long cookies should persist on the client side.
The unavailable scenarios of javax.servlet.http.HttpSession.setMaxInactiveInterval(): need to specify a lifespan for a cookie on the client side, as this method is for session management on the server side.
Claim: avax.servlet.http.Cookie.setMaxAge() can be used in the above unavailable scenarios of javax.servlet.http.HttpSession.setMaxInactiveInterval().

API Knowledge:
The available scenarios of javax.xml.bind.JAXB.marshal(): want to serialize a Java object into XML for storage or transmission.
The unavailable scenarios of javax.xml.xpath.XPath.evaluate(): need to serialize Java objects into XML; this method is for querying XML documents.
Claim: javax.xml.bind.JAXB.marshal() can be used in the above unavailable scenarios of javax.xml.xpath.XPath.evaluate().

API Knowledge:
The available scenarios of javax.sql.DataSource.getConnection(): need a database connection that is managed for efficient reuse.
The unavailable scenarios of java.sql.DriverManager.getConnection(): need a connection from a connection pool for better resource management.
Claim: javax.sql.DataSource.getConnection() can be used in the above unavailable scenarios of java.sql.DriverManager.getConnection().

API Knowledge:
The available scenarios of javax.jms.QueueSender.send(): need to send messages to a JMS queue for asynchronous processing.
The unavailable scenarios of javax.mail.Transport.send(): need to send messages to a messaging system that is not email-based.
Claim: javax.jms.QueueSender.send() can be used in the above unavailable scenarios of javax.mail.Transport.send().
